IUCN Red List (Species Assessed for Global Conservation)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Found in rocky habitats of shoreline areas (Ref. 58302).  Omnivorous and feed on both plant and animal matter (Ref. 44091).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Africa:  endemic to Lake Malawi.  Occurs in Masinje Rocks, Cape Ngombo.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Eastern Africa: Lake Malawi; introduced in Hawaiian Islands.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Males are brilliant sky blue to dark blue; the colors show a "checkerboard" pattern with alternating light and dark patches; several light-colored "egg spots" on their anal fin; females and juveniles bright yellow-orange in color (Ref. 44091).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: Maternal mouthbrooders; males establish territories and maintain a harem of females; female deposits eggs and picks them up in the mouth for incubation; male spreads out his anal fin showing the "eggs pots"; the females  mistake these spots for her eggs and try to also take them inside her mouth; the male then releases his milt and the female takes them in, thus fertilizing the eggs inside her mouth (Ref. 44091).
